controllers

Class OrderMedicalTestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.OrderMedicalTestController

  • @PUBLICAPI
public class OrderMedicalTestController
extends java.lang.Object
    Use to order medical tests for patients.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OrderMedicalTestController(LoginController loginController, ConsultPatientFileController consultPatientFileController)
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> scheduler.HospitalDate addMedicaltest(medicaltest.MedicalTestFactory medicalTestFactory)
      Adds a new medical test created from the given factory to the patient file currently opened and tries to schedule it right away.
      java.util.Collection getMedicalTestFactories()
      Use to select the factory with which you would like to create a medical test.
      java.util.Collection<PatientFileIN> getPatientFiles()
      Use the returned collection to set the patient file field of the medical test factory that you want to use to create a medical test for the patient file that has been opened.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrderMedicalTestController

        @PUBLICAPI
public OrderMedicalTestController(LoginController loginController,
                                    ConsultPatientFileController consultPatientFileController)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        loginController - The login controller of the user that watns to order medical tests for a patient in this hospital.
        consultPatientFileController - The consult patient file controller of the user that watns to order a medical test.
        Throws:
        exceptions.InvalidLoginControllerException - If the user that is stored in the given login controller is not a doctor or if the controller is invalid in any other way.
        exceptions.InvalidHospitalException
        exceptions.InvalidConsultPatientFileController - If the consult patient file controller given to this constructor is invalid in any way.
        exceptions.InvalidPatientFileException - If the patient file opened in the consult patient file controller has been discharged.
        See Also:
        HospitalController, NeedsLoginAndPatientFileController

    • Method Detail

      • getMedicalTestFactories

        @PUBLICAPI
public java.util.Collection getMedicalTestFactories()
        Use to select the factory with which you would like to create a medical test.
        Returns:
        A collection of factories that let you create medical tests.

      • getPatientFiles

        @PUBLICAPI
public java.util.Collection<PatientFileIN> getPatientFiles()
        Use the returned collection to set the patient file field of the medical test factory that you want to use to create a medical test for the patient file that has been opened.

      • addMedicaltest

        @PUBLICAPI
public <T> scheduler.HospitalDate addMedicaltest(medicaltest.MedicalTestFactory medicalTestFactory)
        Adds a new medical test created from the given factory to the patient file currently opened and tries to schedule it right away.
        Returns:
        Returns null when the scheduling fails, otherwise returns the date the test has been scheduled on.
        Throws:
        exceptions.FactoryInstantiationException - If a problem occurs while creating the description with the set parameters in the given factory.
        exceptions.CanNeverBeScheduledException - If there is not enough staff in the hospital to schedule the requested medical test.
